text: Bière trouvé a Bangalore. Rien ne la differencie dune lager, nez leger malté un peu sucré, comme le gout, on sent pas trop le gout de lalcool. Malgrés tout pas mauvaise

I got this at Randall's. Pours pale yellow with a white head. Taste apple, slightly sweet, flat tasting. I thought this was bad. I wouldn't drink this again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle:
Clear, bubbly gold with a soft white head.
Scent is light, sweet grain malt...lemon.
Taste is cider-like, tangy apple, lemon.
A little stale, but still fairly sharp bodied.
Much better than Hercules Lager.
Aroma is malts and a strong resemblance of paint.  The flavor is citrus, the off-paint like from the aroma, a hint of cider and a hint of hops in the finish.
Bottle.  Almost identical to the standard Hercules Lager aside from a little extra alcohol and a deeper hue to the golden color.  Still pretty good stuff.
Bottle. Pours yellow/gold, with a white head. Aroma is malt, grain, and sugar. Flavor is much the same as the aroma, with a little fruit in there too. Medium body. Not too bad.

bottle - Pours clear gold with a very small white head.  It smells of light, grainy malt.  The flavor is sweet, smooth, grainy malt.  Theres some light hops bitterness in there.  Its not too, too bad.
A pale yellow pour with very little white head.  The aroma is like wet hay mixed with some faint hops and cat piss.  The taste is sweet with obvious alcohol of a vodkalike quality and a quick finish.

Bottle from Malt & Vine. So, the finest German malt and hops turn into: Pours gold with a foamy white head. LIghtly bready aroma with mild grassy/floral hop. Medium body, light sharpish carbonation. Flavor is a little bready, and then the hop bitter takes over. The hop is more herby than grassy, but its there. No particular heat to notice. Not my preference, but better than many malt liquors. Id drink it all, if nothing better was around.

(bottle - 22 oz) Clear gold with a fizzy white head. Aroma is sweet corn, grass, and some hops. Very mild. Very sweet at the start with a lot of corn notes mixing with some wet grass and a very mild bitter hop finish. Watery and plasticy at the finish. Eh.
